intro: Bulbophyllum trisetum, commonly known as the Three-Haired Bulbophyllum, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, hairy pseudobulbs that give it its common name. The plant produces intricate, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance.
